page.title: 05Housing in Bristol
page.content:
There are quite a few Georgian houses in Bristol. They are quite big and have a cellar, an attic and 3 or 4 floors. They often have porches in front of the doors, which are very ornate. As they didn't have central heating when they were built, they have fireplaces in every room, which some people still use in winter. Above the windows, outside, they have bricks arranged like a fan. The cellars are for keeping the coal in. There is a chute with a metal cover on it coming from the road leading to the cellar and coalmen can pour coal down it.
There are also quite a lot of Victorian houses in Bristol. They are sometimes detached, semi-detached or terraced. Victorian houses usually have big and echoey rooms.
